NBA map function

Source: R/maps.R
NBA_map.Rd

NBA maps for protection level, threat status, and condition. The function can take a dataset with either one polygon or multipolygon per ecosystem (each row has a unique ecosystem) or multiple rows per ecosystem type.

Usage

nba_map(
  DF,
  GEOM = c("vector", "raster"),
  FILL,
  LEGEND = FALSE,
  MOE = FALSE,
  LWD = 0.1,
  SCALE_TEXT = 1
)

Arguments

DF

The data frame that contains the information

GEOM

Whether the layer is a vector or a raster. Vectors must be sf objects and rasters must be terra (spatraster) objects

FILL

The column that contains the categories to colour the ecosystems by (e.g. protection level, threat status, or condition)

LEGEND

True to include the legend in the plot, False to exclude it

MOE

True to include the Map orientation elements (MOE) of a scale bar and north arrow, False to exclude

LWD

Line width to use in the plot

SCALE_TEXT

scale the sizes of the plot text to fit your intended output. currently set at 1 as default. If you want to save it to 8 by 6 cm, set it to 0.5.

Value

Returns a map

Details

The function expects an sf object.

Please look at the example data NBA_example_map_data to see the correct structure for the data.

The name of the fill column is irrelevant, but the categories must be spelled correctly (there is a list of the standard spellings/ cases of NBA categories named nbaR::NBA_categories in this package, which can be accessed for reference).

Examples


map <- nba_map(DF = NBA_example_map_data,
GEOM = "vector",
FILL = protection_level,
LEGEND = TRUE,
MOE = TRUE)

map
